description: Master SAP FI concepts including General Ledger Configuration, Accounts Payable and Receivable, Asset Accounting, and Period-End Closing procedures

slides.title: Welcome to SAP Financial Accounting
slides.content:
# SAP Financial Accounting (FI)

SAP FI is the core module for **external financial reporting**, managing all financial transactions and generating statutory reports.

## What You Will Learn

- **General Ledger Configuration** - Setting up the GL
- **Accounts Payable (AP)** - Managing vendor payments
- **Accounts Receivable (AR)** - Managing customer receipts
- **Asset Accounting (AA)** - Fixed asset management
- **Period-End Closing** - Month and year-end procedures

## FI Sub-Modules

| Sub-Module | Purpose |
|------------|--------|
| **FI-GL** | General Ledger |
| **FI-AP** | Accounts Payable |
| **FI-AR** | Accounts Receivable |
| **FI-AA** | Asset Accounting |
| **FI-BL** | Bank Accounting |
| **FI-TV** | Travel Management |

## Integration with Other Modules

```
MM (Purchase) --> FI-AP (Vendor Invoice)
SD (Sales)    --> FI-AR (Customer Invoice)
PP (Production) --> CO (Cost) --> FI (GL)
HR (Payroll)  --> FI (Expense Posting)
```

> **FI captures every financial event** in the organization!

slides.title: General Ledger Architecture
slides.content:
# General Ledger in SAP FI

## New GL Architecture (S/4HANA)

### Classic GL vs New GL

| Feature | Classic GL | New GL |
|---------|-----------|--------|
| Document Splitting | No | Yes |
| Real-time Integration | No | Yes |
| Parallel Ledgers | Limited | Full |
| Segment Reporting | Via Business Area | Native |

## Key GL Components

### Chart of Accounts
```
Operational COA (CAUS)
    |
    +-- 100000-199999 Assets
    +-- 200000-299999 Liabilities
    +-- 300000-399999 Equity
    +-- 400000-499999 Revenue
    +-- 500000-599999 Expenses
```

### Account Groups
- Control number ranges
- Define field status
- Group similar accounts

### Fiscal Year Variant
Defines:
- Number of periods (12 + special)
- Period start/end dates
- Year-dependent/independent

## GL Configuration Path

```
SPRO > Financial Accounting > 
  General Ledger Accounting > 
    GL Accounts > Master Records
```

## Key Transaction Codes

| TCode | Description |
|-------|-------------|
| FS00 | Create/Change GL Account |
| FS10N | GL Account Balance |
| FAGLB03 | Display Balances (New GL) |
| FB01 | Post Document |

> **The GL is the heart** of SAP Financial Accounting!

slides.title: GL Document Posting
slides.content:
# Posting to the General Ledger

## Document Entry Screen (FB01)

### Header Data
- Document Date
- Posting Date
- Document Type (SA for GL)
- Company Code
- Currency
- Reference
- Header Text

### Line Item Data
- Posting Key (40=Debit, 50=Credit)
- Account Number
- Amount
- Cost Center (if required)
- Text

## Example: Recording Rent Expense

```
Document Type: SA (GL Posting)
Posting Date: 31.01.2024
Reference: RENT-JAN

Line 1:
  PK: 40 (Debit)
  Account: 515000 (Rent Expense)
  Amount: 5,000.00
  Cost Center: 1000

Line 2:
  PK: 50 (Credit)
  Account: 100000 (Bank Account)
  Amount: 5,000.00
```

## Document Types

| Type | Description |
|------|-------------|
| SA | GL Account Document |
| AB | Accounting Document |
| AA | Asset Posting |
| AF | Depreciation Posting |

## Posting Keys

| Key | Type | Account |
|-----|------|--------|
| 40 | Debit | GL |
| 50 | Credit | GL |
| 01 | Debit | Customer |
| 11 | Credit | Customer |
| 21 | Credit | Vendor |
| 31 | Debit | Vendor |

> **Every posting creates a complete document!**

slides.title: GL Posting Check
slides.content: Test your GL posting knowledge!
slides.quizQuestion: Which posting key is used to credit a GL account?

slides.title: Accounts Payable Overview
slides.content:
# Accounts Payable (FI-AP)

## Purpose

Manage **vendor relationships and payments** - tracking what you owe and ensuring timely payment.

## AP Process Flow

```
Purchase Order (MM)
        |
        v
Goods Receipt (MM)
        |
        v
Invoice Receipt (FI-AP)  --> Three-Way Match
        |
        v
Payment Processing (FI-AP)
        |
        v
Bank Reconciliation
```

## Key AP Transactions

| TCode | Function |
|-------|----------|
| FB60 | Enter Vendor Invoice |
| MIRO | Invoice Verification (MM) |
| F-43 | Post Vendor Invoice |
| F-44 | Clear Vendor |
| F110 | Automatic Payment Run |
| FBL1N | Vendor Line Items |
| FK10N | Vendor Balance |

## Vendor Invoice Entry (FB60)

### Required Fields
- Vendor Number
- Invoice Date
- Posting Date
- Amount
- GL Account (expense)
- Tax Code

### Optional Fields
- Reference (vendor invoice number)
- Text
- Payment terms
- Baseline date

## Vendor Reconciliation Account

AP account in GL updated automatically:
```
Vendor Invoice:
  Dr: Expense Account
  Cr: AP Reconciliation Account (via Vendor)
```

> **AP ensures vendors are paid correctly and on time!**

slides.title: AP Invoice Processing
slides.content:
# Vendor Invoice Processing

## Invoice Entry Methods

### 1. Direct Entry (FB60)
For non-PO invoices:
- Services without PO
- Utility bills
- Recurring expenses

### 2. Invoice Verification (MIRO)
For PO-based invoices:
- Three-way match
- Quantity and price verification
- GR/IR account clearing

## Three-Way Match

```
Purchase Order    Goods Receipt    Invoice
    |                   |              |
    +----> Quantity <---+              |
    |                                  |
    +-----------> Price <--------------+
```

Validations:
- Quantity received vs invoiced
- Price on PO vs invoice
- Tolerance limits

## Invoice Parking

Preliminary posting without affecting balances:

| TCode | Function |
|-------|----------|
| FV60 | Park Invoice |
| FBV0 | Post Parked Document |

## Invoice Blocking

Reasons for blocking:
- Payment block (manual)
- Price variance
- Quantity variance
- Quality issues

## Example: Service Invoice

```
Vendor: 100001 (Office Services Ltd)
Invoice Date: 15.01.2024
Amount: 1,500.00

Line Items:
  515100 - Consulting Services  1,200.00
  515200 - Travel Reimbursement    300.00
  ----------------------------------------
  Total:                         1,500.00
```

> **Accurate invoice processing** prevents payment errors!

slides.title: AP Payment Processing
slides.content:
# Vendor Payments

## Payment Methods

| Method | Use Case |
|--------|----------|
| Check | Traditional payment |
| Bank Transfer | Electronic payment |
| Wire | International/urgent |
| ACH | Automated clearing |

## Automatic Payment Program (F110)

### Process Steps

1. **Parameters** - Company code, payment method, dates
2. **Proposal** - System identifies items due
3. **Edit Proposal** - Review and modify
4. **Payment Run** - Execute payments
5. **Print/Electronic** - Generate output

### F110 Screen

```
+------------------------------------------+
| Run Date: 15.01.2024                     |
| Identification: PAY001                    |
+------------------------------------------+
| Parameters    | Proposal | Payment Run  |
| [Maintain]    | [Create] | [Execute]    |
+------------------------------------------+
| Status:       | Printout:               |
| [View Log]    | [Generate]              |
+------------------------------------------+
```

## Payment Terms

| Term | Description |
|------|-------------|
| Z001 | Net 30 days |
| Z002 | 2% 10 Net 30 |
| ZB01 | Due on receipt |

## Cash Discount

```
Invoice: $10,000
Terms: 2% 10 Net 30
Paid within 10 days: $9,800
Saved: $200
```

> **Optimize payments** to capture discounts!

slides.title: Accounts Receivable Overview
slides.content:
# Accounts Receivable (FI-AR)

## Purpose

Manage **customer relationships and collections** - tracking what customers owe and ensuring timely collection.

## AR Process Flow

```
Sales Order (SD)
        |
        v
Delivery (SD)
        |
        v
Billing Document (SD) --> FI-AR Invoice
        |
        v
Payment Receipt (FI-AR)
        |
        v
Bank Reconciliation
```

## Key AR Transactions

| TCode | Function |
|-------|----------|
| FB70 | Enter Customer Invoice |
| VF01 | Create Billing (SD) |
| F-28 | Post Incoming Payment |
| F-32 | Clear Customer |
| FBL5N | Customer Line Items |
| FD10N | Customer Balance |
| F150 | Dunning Run |

## Customer Invoice Entry (FB70)

### Required Fields
- Customer Number
- Invoice Date
- Posting Date
- Amount
- GL Account (revenue)

## Integration with Sales

```
SD Billing (VF01)
        |
        v
Automatic FI Posting:
  Dr: AR Reconciliation (via Customer)
  Cr: Revenue Account
  Cr: Tax Account
```

## Credit Management

- Credit limits per customer
- Credit exposure monitoring
- Order blocking on credit issues

> **AR drives cash flow** - collect efficiently!

slides.title: AR Quiz
slides.content: Test your AR knowledge!
slides.quizQuestion: Which transaction code is used to enter a customer incoming payment?

slides.title: Customer Payments and Clearing
slides.content:
# Processing Customer Payments

## Payment Entry (F-28)

### Header Information
- Document Date
- Posting Date
- Company Code
- Currency
- Bank Account

### Selection Criteria
- Customer Account
- Open Items Selection

## Clearing Process

```
Open Invoice: $5,000 (Debit)
Payment:      $5,000 (Credit)
                     --------
Cleared:           $0
```

## Partial Payments

### Options

1. **Partial Payment**
   - Leave original open
   - Record payment on account
   - Match later

2. **Residual Item**
   - Clear original
   - Create new open item for difference

## Example: Partial Payment

```
Invoice: $10,000
Payment: $8,000

Option 1 - Partial:
  Invoice remains open: $10,000
  Payment on account: $8,000
  Net open: $2,000

Option 2 - Residual:
  Original invoice: Cleared
  New residual item: $2,000
```

## Automatic Clearing (F.13)

Batch clear matching items:
- Same amount
- Same reference
- Assignment field matching

## Cash Application

| Source | Method |
|--------|--------|
| Lockbox | Electronic file |
| Bank statement | Electronic import |
| Manual | F-28 entry |

> **Timely clearing** keeps AR accurate!

slides.title: Dunning Process
slides.content:
# Dunning - Collection Management

## What is Dunning?

Dunning is the **systematic process** of reminding customers about overdue payments.

## Dunning Procedure

### Dunning Levels

| Level | Days Overdue | Action |
|-------|--------------|--------|
| 1 | 1-30 | Friendly reminder |
| 2 | 31-60 | Formal notice |
| 3 | 61-90 | Urgent demand |
| 4 | 90+ | Final notice |

### Dunning Configuration

```
Dunning Procedure: 0001
  |
  +-- Level 1: 14 days grace, 1% interest
  +-- Level 2: 28 days grace, 1.5% interest
  +-- Level 3: 42 days grace, 2% interest
  +-- Level 4: 56 days, legal action
```

## Dunning Run (F150)

### Process Steps

1. **Parameters** - Dunning date, company code
2. **Proposal** - System identifies overdue items
3. **Edit** - Review and modify selections
4. **Print** - Generate dunning letters

## Dunning Key Concepts

| Term | Meaning |
|------|--------|
| Dunning Level | Current collection stage |
| Dunning Block | Prevent dunning |
| Grace Days | Buffer before action |
| Minimum Amount | Threshold for dunning |

## Excluding Items from Dunning

- Disputed invoices
- Small balances
- Items under review
- VIP customers

> **Consistent dunning** improves collection rates!

slides.title: Asset Accounting Overview
slides.content:
# Asset Accounting (FI-AA)

## Purpose

Manage the **complete lifecycle** of fixed assets from acquisition to retirement.

## Asset Lifecycle

```
Acquisition --> Capitalization --> Depreciation
                                        |
                     +------------------+
                     |
              Retirement/Sale
```

## Key Asset Transactions

| TCode | Function |
|-------|----------|
| AS01 | Create Asset |
| AS02 | Change Asset |
| AS03 | Display Asset |
| ABZON | Acquisition with Auto-PO |
| ABSO | Asset Sale without Customer |
| ABAON | Asset Retirement |
| AFAB | Depreciation Run |
| AW01N | Asset Explorer |

## Asset Master Record

### General Data
- Description
- Asset class
- Serial number
- Location/Cost center

### Time-Dependent Data
- Cost center assignments
- Responsible person

### Depreciation Areas
- Book depreciation
- Tax depreciation
- Other (IFRS, management)

## Asset Classes

| Class | Description | Useful Life |
|-------|-------------|-------------|
| 1000 | Buildings | 40 years |
| 2000 | Machinery | 10 years |
| 3000 | Vehicles | 5 years |
| 4000 | Furniture | 7 years |
| 5000 | IT Equipment | 3 years |

> **Complete asset tracking** is essential for accurate financial statements!

slides.title: Asset Depreciation
slides.content:
# Depreciation in SAP

## Depreciation Methods

### Straight-Line (SLM)
```
Annual Dep = (Cost - Salvage) / Useful Life

Asset: $100,000
Salvage: $10,000
Life: 10 years

Annual Dep = ($100,000 - $10,000) / 10 = $9,000
```

### Declining Balance (DB)
```
Year 1 Dep = Cost x Rate

$100,000 x 20% = $20,000

Year 2: $80,000 x 20% = $16,000
```

## Depreciation Areas

| Area | Purpose |
|------|--------|
| 01 | Book Depreciation (GAAP) |
| 02 | Tax Depreciation |
| 10 | Cost Accounting |
| 20 | Consolidated (IFRS) |

## Depreciation Run (AFAB)

### Parameters
- Company Code
- Fiscal Year
- Posting Period
- Test Run (first)

### Run Types
- Planned Depreciation
- Unplanned Depreciation
- Repeat Run

## Depreciation Posting

```
Dr: Depreciation Expense (P&L)
Cr: Accumulated Depreciation (B/S)

Amount: $9,000 monthly
```

## Asset Values View (AW01N)

```
+--------------------------------+
| Asset Explorer                  |
+--------------------------------+
| Acquisition Value:  $100,000   |
| Accum. Depreciation: ($45,000) |
| Net Book Value:       $55,000  |
+--------------------------------+
```

> **Regular depreciation runs** keep asset values current!

slides.title: Asset Quiz
slides.content: Test your asset accounting knowledge!
slides.quizQuestion: Which transaction code is used to run depreciation in SAP?

slides.title: Bank Accounting
slides.content:
# Bank Accounting in SAP

## Bank Master Data

### House Bank
Your company's bank accounts:

```
House Bank: BOFA
  |
  +-- Account ID: CHECKING
  |   GL: 100000
  |
  +-- Account ID: SAVINGS
      GL: 100100
```

### Bank Directory
External bank information for payments.

## Bank Statement Processing

### Electronic Bank Statement (EBS)

| TCode | Function |
|-------|----------|
| FF_5 | Import Bank Statement |
| FEBA | Post Bank Statement |
| FF67 | Manual Bank Statement |

### Processing Steps

1. Import electronic file
2. Automatic matching
3. Manual post unmapped items
4. Reconcile

## Bank Reconciliation

```
GL Bank Balance:        $150,000
- Outstanding Checks:    (15,000)
+ Deposits in Transit:    10,000
                        ---------
Adjusted GL Balance:    $145,000

Bank Statement Balance: $145,000

Difference:                   $0
```

## Cash Management

| Function | Purpose |
|----------|--------|
| Cash Position | Current cash levels |
| Liquidity Forecast | Future cash needs |
| Cash Concentration | Pool cash across accounts |

## Key Configuration

```
SPRO > Financial Accounting >
  Bank Accounting >
    Bank Accounts
```

> **Bank reconciliation** ensures cash accuracy!

slides.title: Period-End Closing Overview
slides.content:
# Month and Year-End Closing

## Closing Timeline

### Daily/Ongoing
- Transaction posting
- Document verification
- Report generation

### Month-End
- Accruals and deferrals
- Depreciation run
- Foreign currency revaluation
- Allocations
- Financial statements

### Year-End
- All month-end activities
- Balance carry forward
- Opening new fiscal year
- Audit adjustments

## Closing Cockpit

```
+------------------------------------------+
| Closing Cockpit - January 2024           |
+------------------------------------------+
| Task                    | Status         |
+-------------------------+----------------+
| Depreciation Run        | [Completed]    |
| Foreign Currency Reval  | [In Progress]  |
| Accruals Posting        | [Pending]      |
| Period Close            | [Pending]      |
+------------------------------------------+
```

## Key Closing Transactions

| TCode | Function |
|-------|----------|
| OB52 | Open/Close Posting Periods |
| AFAB | Depreciation Run |
| F.05 | Foreign Currency Valuation |
| FAGLF101 | Balance Carryforward |
| F.16 | G/L Balance Carryforward |

## Posting Period Control

```
Period 01 (Jan): Closed
Period 02 (Feb): Open for posting
Period 03+ : Future (closed)
```

> **Structured closing** ensures timely, accurate financials!

slides.title: Year-End Closing Procedures
slides.content:
# Year-End Closing in SAP

## Preparation Steps

1. **Complete all transactions** for the year
2. **Run all period-end processes** for final period
3. **Reconcile** all accounts
4. **Review** intercompany balances
5. **Post audit adjustments**

## Balance Carry Forward

### Process
- Transfer closing balances to new year opening
- Automatic for balance sheet accounts
- P&L accounts close to retained earnings

### Transaction: FAGLF101

```
+----------------------------------+
| Balance Carryforward             |
+----------------------------------+
| Company Code: 1000               |
| Fiscal Year: 2024                |
| -------------------------------- |
| [X] Carry Forward                |
| [X] P&L to Retained Earnings     |
+----------------------------------+
```

## Opening New Fiscal Year

| Task | Transaction |
|------|-------------|
| Open FI periods | OB52 |
| Open CO periods | OKP1 |
| Open MM periods | MMPV |
| Open Asset periods | OAAQ |

## Year-End Checklist

- [ ] Complete depreciation for year
- [ ] Foreign currency revaluation
- [ ] Regrouping (receivables/payables)
- [ ] Balance confirmations
- [ ] Audit adjustments
- [ ] Financial statements
- [ ] Balance carryforward
- [ ] Open new year periods

> **Plan year-end early** for a smooth closing!

slides.title: Financial Reporting
slides.content:
# Financial Reports in SAP

## Standard Financial Reports

### Balance Sheet
```
S_ALR_87012284 - Balance Sheet

                    Debit      Credit
Assets             500,000
Liabilities                   300,000
Equity                        200,000
                   -------    -------
Total              500,000    500,000
```

### Profit & Loss
```
S_ALR_87012271 - P&L Statement

Revenue                     800,000
Cost of Sales              (400,000)
                           ---------
Gross Profit                400,000
Operating Expenses         (250,000)
                           ---------
Net Income                  150,000
```

## Report Types

| Report | TCode |
|--------|-------|
| Financial Statements | S_ALR_87012284 |
| Trial Balance | S_ALR_87012277 |
| GL Account Balances | FS10N |
| Document Journal | S_ALR_87012287 |

## Report Painter/Writer

Create custom financial reports:
- Define rows and columns
- Select data sources
- Format output

## Drilldown Reporting

Interactive navigation:
```
Total Revenue: $800,000
    |
    v
By Region:
  North: $400,000
  South: $250,000
  West: $150,000
      |
      v
  By Customer...
```

> **SAP provides comprehensive** financial reporting!

slides.title: Integration with Controlling
slides.content:
# FI-CO Integration

## Real-Time Integration

Every FI posting triggers CO posting:

```
FI Document
    |
    v
Primary Cost Element --> CO Object
```

## Cost Elements

| Type | Source |
|------|--------|
| Primary | From FI GL accounts |
| Secondary | Created in CO only |

## Automatic Account Assignment

### Example: Expense Posting

```
FI Entry:
  Dr: 515000 Rent Expense    $5,000
  Cr: 100000 Bank            $5,000

Automatic CO Posting:
  Cost Center 1000: $5,000
  Cost Element: 515000
```

## CO Assignment Objects

| Object | Example |
|--------|--------|
| Cost Center | Department |
| Internal Order | Project |
| WBS Element | Large project |
| Profit Center | Business segment |

## Reconciliation

```
FI Balance (GL 515000):  $50,000
CO Balance (CE 515000):  $50,000
                        --------
Difference:                  $0
```

## Configuration

```
SPRO > Controlling > Cost Element Accounting >
  Automatic Account Assignment
```

> **FI and CO work together** for complete financial management!

slides.title: Period-End Quiz
slides.content: Test your closing knowledge!
slides.quizQuestion: Which transaction is used to open and close posting periods in SAP?

slides.title: Summary and Key Takeaways
slides.content:
# Congratulations! Summary

You have completed the **SAP Financial Accounting** lesson!

## Key Concepts Mastered

### General Ledger
- Chart of Accounts structure
- Document posting (FB01)
- Account determination

### Accounts Payable
- Vendor invoice processing (FB60, MIRO)
- Three-way matching
- Automatic payments (F110)

### Accounts Receivable
- Customer invoicing (FB70)
- Payment processing (F-28)
- Dunning (F150)

### Asset Accounting
- Asset lifecycle management
- Depreciation methods and runs (AFAB)
- Asset explorer (AW01N)

### Period-End Closing
- Month-end activities
- Year-end balance carryforward
- Period control (OB52)

## Quick Reference

| Process | Key TCode |
|---------|----------|
| GL Posting | FB01 |
| Vendor Invoice | FB60/MIRO |
| Vendor Payment | F110 |
| Customer Invoice | FB70 |
| Customer Payment | F-28 |
| Depreciation | AFAB |
| Close Periods | OB52 |

## What is Next?

Explore:
- SAP Controlling (CO)
- SAP Integration Scenarios
- Advanced FICO Configuration

> **You now have a solid foundation** in SAP Financial Accounting!
